results.title: Management: a fundamental question (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
This episode asks the complex question: what is management? Since there are many diverse management systems, this episode follows a day in the life of two very different managers - Tricia Caswell, Director of the Australian Conservation Foundation and Michael Bowman from Ford Australia. The Chief Executive Officer of the City of Melbourne, Elizabeth Proust, joins Kerry O’Brien in the studio.

results.title: Management in the community
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Confusion in the elderly”.
One of a series about the techniques for management and treatment of confusion in the elderly. Traces the case of an elderly woman whose family wants to have her committed to hospital or a home. However, with medical advice it is possible for her to remain at home.

results.title: Management in hospital
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Confusion in the elderly”.
One of a series about the techniques for management and treatment of confusion in the elderly. This demonstrates a variety of treatments of admission to hospital. Shows actual patients with different presentations of confusion, and outlines basic principles of management designed to allow the patients to get the most out of life.

results.title: Management by objectives : performance and potential review
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Introduced by John Humble, the film shows the second stage of management by objectives within a company. Having established individual responsibilities and improvement requirements previously, performance is reviewed three months later. The film also covers reviewing of individual potential from results obtained during the previous process. Intended for use with study material

results.title: Management and top-dressing of pastures
results.brief_description: Stresses the need for pastoralists to maintain their grasslands once established. Shows the use of superphosphate in seeding, also lime and trace elements (in this case, molybdenum). While showing the use of an electric fence for regulated use of pasture, the film warns against overgrazing of the resulting strips. Also explains the need to let grass mature to maximum feed value, and to keep down weeds. Suggests that farmers should grow and store surplus feed.

results.title: Management and supervisory skills
results.brief_description: Using a case study, this program looks at examples of poor supervisory and management skills such as poor delegation, improper use of authority, and being a poor role model. Conversely, it looks at the factors which contribute to good management, such as; effective business planning and review, accurate record keeping, identifying performance indicators, setting realistic goals and objectives, open communication, cost control, continuous training, and promoting confidence and respect in the work place. The guide which accompanies the video outlines the key areas of planning- setting objectives; controlling costs; improving methods and making decisions.
